article.headline: VA Commonwealth 67, Towson 60
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. (AP) -- B.A. Walker hit a 3-pointer from the top of the key, giving Virginia Commonwealth a seven-point lead with 35.5 seconds remaining Saturday as it went on to defeat Towson 67-60 in a quarterfinal game of the Colonial Athletic Association tournament. The Rams (21-7) advanced to play the winner of the Old Dominion-Hofstra game in a semifinal contest Sunday. With Saturday's loss, Towson finishes 8-21, losing 12 of their last 14 games. The Rams led most of the way after grabbing a 23-13 lead with 10:36 left, but the Tigers rallied, taking a 27-25 lead on Mike Green's 3-pointer with 4:13 remaining. A 3-pointer by Walker gave the Rams a 28-27 lead and Virginia Commonwealth held a 35-31 advantage at the half. The Rams started the second half with a 13-4 run, led by two 3-pointers by Walker. Towson could get no closer than six until Jamaal Gilchrist's 3-pointer cut the lead to 62-58 with 1:08 left. Gilchrist finished with 11 points after scoring 32 in Fridays' first-round game. Green led the Tigers with 18 points and Derrick Goode added 10. Troy Godwin scored 15 points, Nick George added 14 and Walker, 12.
